newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ average hourly earnings rise 3.8 pct in Feb yr.
newsitem.headline: NZ average hourly earnings rise 3.8 pct in Feb yr.

text.p: Average total hourly earnings of New Zealand employees rose by 3.8 percent to NZ$16.53 in the year to February, Statistics New Zealand said on Thursday.

"If confirmed when final estimates are released in September, this would be the largest annual increase since May 1991, when the annual increase was also 3.8 percent," SNZ said in releasing its Quarterly Employment Survey.
Ordinary time average hourly earnings rose by 3.9 percent to $16.41 in the year to February 1997.
Average ordinary time hourly earnings increased by 4.6 percent and 3.6 percent respectively in the public and private sectors, SNZ said.
Ordinary time hourly earnings for males rose 3.8 percent in the year to February, while females' earnings increased by 4.2 percent over the period.
Average total weekly paid hours of employees decreased by 0.5 percent to 39.19 hours in the February year. Average overtime hours fell by 7.6 percent to 1.7 hours per week.
Overtime hours fell by 7.1 percent and 13.2 percent respectively in the private and public sectors.
Average total weekly earnings rose 3.3 percent in the February year, down from 3.6 percent in the year to November 1996, SNZ said.
It said on average, employees were earning $647.74 a week during February.
